result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Hartfield

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio Hartfield appeared by video.  Attorney Erica N Young appeared by video for Antonio Hartfield.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant needs to complete a TAD evaluation. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio Hartfield not in court.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel does not appear.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio Hartfield in court.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status of counsel. PD's appointment office unable to appoint for hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio Hartfield in court.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant appears without counsel. 
Court instructed defendant to contact the State Public Defender's Office to be evaluated for eligibility and to provide determination by the next court date. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
$500 signature bond to remain as well as all other conditions.

Defendant Antonio Hartfield in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio Hartfield in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antonio Hartfield appeared by video means.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Court informed the defendant there is a bench warrant on the case. Court instructed defendant to go to Room 221 of the Safety Building at 1:30pm to clear the warrant.
Case adjourned.

Defendant Antonio Hartfield not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failed to appear to be booked and released on 07-24-2022. Bench warrant authorized for their arrest.

Defendant Antonio Hartfield not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Antonio Hartfield not in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failed to appear to be booked and released on 07-27-2022. Bench warrant authorized for their arrest.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-24-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Antonio Hartfield in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 07/22/2022@130p
